article_title: Canadian Regulators Say Oil in Train Accident Was as Volatile as Gasoline
article_text:
Canadian regulators said the crude oil on a train that derailed in a Quebec town last July and killed 47 people was as volatile as gasoline, highlighting the potential danger of crude shipments by rail.

The report by Canada's Transportation Safety Board marked the first time that government officials have reported comprehensive test results on the train's oil, which was traveling from North Dakota's Bakken Shale formation to a...
